description:
Haruka Ozawa's sophomore year is getting seriously scary. One of her friends is possessed, another has committed suicide and Haruka could be the next one to flunk the still-breathing test. Her only way out of this potentially lethal dead end? Yakumo Saito, an enigmatic student born with a mysterious red eye that allows him to see and communicate with the dead. But the deceased don't always desist and some killers are more than ready to kill again to keep dead men from telling any more tales. That doesn't stop Haruka's knack for digging up buried secrets, and there's even more evidence of bodies being exhumed by both Yakumo's police contact and an investigative journalist with a newly made corpse in her closet! Can this pair of anything but normal paranormal detectives solve the ultimate dead case files or will they end up in cold storage themselves?

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: College
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a college or university.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

node.description:
**Height:** 174 cm (5'8.5")

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/onoDofficial) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/onodofficial/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCHuKRxu3ILwezuNBjpxkIxg) | [Website](http://daisukeono.com/) | [Profile (Lantis)](http://www.lantis.jp/artist.php?id=f4165cba759b0eccd6448d4e72b4d9ad)

**Non-Anime Roles**:
- Jing Yuan - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
- Wriothesley - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Van Arkride - The Legend of Heroes Series (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kawasak54965532)

Hiroyuki Kawasaki is a screenwriter and novelist.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/芝美奈子)

Noted for her character designs on [Black Butler](https://anilist.co/anime/4898/), [Noir](https://anilist.co/anime/272/), [Tegami Bachi](https://anilist.co/anime/6444/) among many others.

[Website](http://www.pyxie-llc.com/minakubota/) | [Blog](http://minakubota.blog8.fc2.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/minakubota)

Mina is a composer and a pianist.

__Graduated:__ Toyo University

During school Sawai always aimed to be manga artist. After graduating from Toyo University he joined Tatsunoko Production where he became a storyboard artist and later episode director. He served two more years as a production assistant there until he left and became a freelance episode director. Today he works mainly for Bee Train, whose founder Kouichi Mashimo is a good friend of his.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dajinman)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/tomoyuki.kurokawa.7)__

__Tomoyuki Kurokawa__ is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist. He was affiliated with studio Bee Train.

He made his lead directorial debut with the OVA _[Murder Princess](https://anilist.co/anime/1696/Murder-Princess/)_, and had his first lead director role with the release of _[Psychic Detective Yakumo](https://anilist.co/anime/7662/Shinrei-Tantei-Yakumo/)_.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dajinman)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/tomoyuki.kurokawa.7)__

__Tomoyuki Kurokawa__ is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist. He was affiliated with studio Bee Train.

He made his lead directorial debut with the OVA _[Murder Princess](https://anilist.co/anime/1696/Murder-Princess/)_, and had his first lead director role with the release of _[Psychic Detective Yakumo](https://anilist.co/anime/7662/Shinrei-Tantei-Yakumo/)_.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dajinman)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/tomoyuki.kurokawa.7)__

__Tomoyuki Kurokawa__ is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist. He was affiliated with studio Bee Train.

He made his lead directorial debut with the OVA _[Murder Princess](https://anilist.co/anime/1696/Murder-Princess/)_, and had his first lead director role with the release of _[Psychic Detective Yakumo](https://anilist.co/anime/7662/Shinrei-Tantei-Yakumo/)_.
Hideaki Muraoka is a Producer and production coordinator working for Bee Train Productions Inc.

__[Profile (Verygoo)](http://www.verygoo.jp/artists/ron/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ron_sdf)__

__Ryuuta Iida__, also known by his stage name Ron (stylized as R・O・N) is a Japanese musician, arranger, composer, lyricist, sound producer, guitarist, keyboardist and singer. He was the sound producer and guitarist of Japanese rock band [OLDCODEX](https://anilist.co/staff/112151/OLDCODEX) along with seiyuu [Tatsuhisa Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/95735) from 2009-2012.

He currently works under the artist management company Verygoo, has a solo vocal project called [Stereo Dive Foundation](https://anilist.co/staff/118710/Stereo-Dive-Foundation), is a member of the rock band [ROSARYHILL](http://rosaryhill.net/) (2008-) as a keyboardist and vocalist, and works as a music creator for the creative music unit [(K)NoW_NAME](https://anilist.co/staff/126602/KNoW-NAME).
